            ],
            "title": [
              [
                "maxCrossover(array)\n  currentLeftSum = 0\n      leftSum = 0\n  currentRightSum = 0\n      rightSum = 0\n  for i in array\n    currentLeftSum += array[i]\n    if currentLeftSum \u003e leftSum\n      leftSum = currentLeftSum\n  for i in array\n    currentRightSum += array[i]\n    if currentRightSum \u003e rightSum\n      rightSum = currentRightSum\n  return leftSum + rightSum"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

            "title": [
              [
                "The problem was originally proposed by "
              ],
              [
                "Ulf Grenander",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulf_Grenander"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " of Brown University in 1977, as a simplified model for maximum likelihood estimation of patterns in digitized images."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      },

      "74151691-c669-4ae6-be5a-a7c13f018407": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929214813,
          "id": "74151691-c669-4ae6-be5a-a7c13f018407",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929214813,
          "parent_id": "bc380fd8-6aec-43a0-a9a6-dbddcbc9cddb",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [
              [
                "Plain Text"
              ]
            ],
            "title": [
              [
                "MaxSubarray(array)\n  maximum = 0\n  for i in input\n    current = 0\n    for j in input\n       current += array[j]\n       if current \u003e maximum\n         maximum = current\n  return maximum"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "7a9779ee-80b4-485a-bebd-83c32b20f7e8": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929214814,
          "id": "7a9779ee-80b4-485a-bebd-83c32b20f7e8",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929214814,
          "parent_id": "bc380fd8-6aec-43a0-a9a6-dbddcbc9cddb",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Find the sum of the subarrays on the left side, the subarrays on the right. Then, take a look through all of the ones that cross over the center divide, and finally return the maximum sum. Because this is a divide and conquer algorithm, we need to have two different functions."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

                "This algorithm just goes through the loop, continuously changing the current maximum sum. Interestingly enough, this is a very simple example of a dynamic programming algorithm, since it takes an overlapping problem and reduces it so we can find a more efficient solution."
              ]

              [
                "Maximum subarray problem",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_subarray_problem"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " is the method to find the contiguous subarray within a one-dimensional array of numbers which has the largest sum."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1

              ]

          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929214813,
          "id": "e9aecfa8-77c2-46e6-9f56-db0d729461e5",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929214813,
          "parent_id": "bc380fd8-6aec-43a0-a9a6-dbddcbc9cddb",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "We can problem like this, let us consider a list of various integers. We might be interested in which completely adjacent subset will have the greatest sum. For example, if we have the array "
              ],
              [
                "[0, 1, 2, -2, 3, 2]",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ", the maximum subarray is "
              ],
              [
                "[3, 2]",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ", with a sum of "
              ],
              [
                "5",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                "."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      }
    },
    "notion_user": {
